meanings.sent1: I need to reseasoning the soup before serving it.
meanings.sent2: After tasting the stew, I decided to reseasoning it with more salt.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally forgot to reseasoning the chicken, making it bland.
meanings.sent4: She believed that reseasoning her life with new experiences would bring her joy.
meanings.sent5: The old book needed reseasoning with a fresh cover to attract readers.

meanings.definition: The act of adding seasoning to food again.
meanings.sent1: The reseasoning of the salad made it much tastier.
meanings.sent2: I always do a reseasoning of my dishes before serving them.
meanings.sent3: The reseasoning of the popcorn with extra butter was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: The reseasoning of the pasta with herbs gave it a delightful aroma.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to delicious dishes was the reseasoning of every meal.
